snippet: Yolanda Gonzalez was arrested in October 2013 on charges that she stole nearly $900,000 from We Stay/Nos Quedamos, a housing and social service organization founded by her mother.
abstract: Yolanda Gonzalez, former executive director of nonprofit group Nos Quedamos who was arrested in 2013 on charges that she stole nearly $900,000 from the organization, pleads guilty to grand larceny and criminal tax fraud; she faces up to seven and half years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Yolanda Gonzalez was arrested in October 2013 on charges that she stole nearly $900,000 from We Stay/Nos Quedamos, a housing and social service organization founded by her mother.

headline.main: Ex-Chief Pleads Guilty to Stealing From a Bronx Charity
headline.print_headline: Guilty Plea by Ex-Chief in a Theft at a Charity
